title: Pan-Fried Shrimp Recipe
description: This pan-fried shrimp recipe is made with bay shrimp sautéed in butter with lemon juice, salt, and pepper in this quick and easy stovetop recipe.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Seafood Shellfish Shrimp Pan-Fried Shrimp 4.6 (43) 28 Reviews 5 Photos This pan-fried shrimp recipe features small bay shrimp cooked on the stove with simple seasoning. You can add other seasonings if you like. Submitted by LeviCooks Updated on November 13, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 1 pound shrimp Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 8 tablespoons butter, divided 1 pound peeled and deveined bay shrimp 1 tablespoon lemon juice, divided 1 pinch garlic salt, or to taste salt and ground black pepper to taste Directions Melt 6 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over high heat. Add shrimp; cook and stir in hot butter until browned, about 2 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low. Stir in 1 1/2 teaspoons lemon juice, garlic salt, salt, and pepper; cook until heated through, about 1 minute. Remove from heat; stir in remaining 2 tablespoons butter and 1 1/2 teaspoons lemon juice. I Made It Print 269 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Pan-Fried Shrimp 01 of 05 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 05 Photo by  Tracy Washington 06/11/2020 I added cayenne pepper and served over yellow rice with spinach and mushrooms. Delicious 03 of 05 Photo by  Vicki Mahoney 06/03/2020 This was tasty. I added real garlic, grated zucchini and smoked sun dried tomatoes. name: LeviCooks
instructions: Melt 6 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over high heat. Add shrimp; cook and stir in hot butter until browned, about 2 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low.;Stir in 1 1/2 teaspoons lemon juice, garlic salt, salt, and pepper; cook until heated through, about 1 minute. Remove from heat; stir in remaining 2 tablespoons butter and 1 1/2 teaspoons lemon juice.
